content:
Charles Moussa is a Mathematical Engineer/Data Scientist/Quantum Computing Scientist currently doing a PhD on quantum computing and machine learning at Leiden University in the Netherlands.
Download my resumé as a PDF.
summary:
Charles Moussa is a Mathematical Engineer/Data Scientist/Quantum Computing Scientist currently doing a PhD on quantum computing and machine learning at Leiden University in the Netherlands.
Download my resumé as a PDF.
title: Charles Moussa

summary: During QHack 2023, we implemented with Pennylane a resource frugal optimizer named Refoqus from the paper [Resource frugal optimizer for quantum machine learning](https://doi.org/10.1088/2058-9565/acef55). We show how to apply it across 3 QML applications on quantum datasets.
title: Adaptative VQA Optimizers

summary: The results of the paper [Hyperparameter Importance of Quantum Neural Networks Across Small Datasets](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-18840-4_3). This work has also been extended, and published in the journal [Machine Learning by Springer](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10994-023-06389-8), to include an extra set of experiments assessing the usefulness of using priors of good hyperparameter values of Quantum Neural Networks for hyperparameter optimization.
title: Hyperparameter Importance of Quantum Neural Networks Across Small Datasets
